text: 473ml can shared with Guillaume. Thanks for the share Guillaume. Aroma: intense citra aroma near. LOTS of juicy citrus, some peaches oranges on a slightly malted background. App: really hazy straw with almost brown tint, minimal white head, little lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, extremely juicy, light bitter finish. Overall: like the original version this is extremely easy to drink. Could drink this every day.. In the morning.

16 oz. can from seeswo - thanks again, Chris! Pours a very, very hazy goldenrod color with a small white head that settles into a ring and a few wisps of film. The citra really hops here, with loads of citrus and tropical fruits, orange and pineapple and melon and mango and grapefruit peel, with fresh flowers and herbs, subtle sweet malts, and a bit of pine resin. Light-medium bodied, with a bitter, juicy mouthfeel and low carbonation. Really nice.

Amazing APA. Color pours like orange juice, and the hops are perfect. Overall this is in the top 2 beers of pale ale I have ever tried. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Canned 5-8-17. Pours a hazy orange juice-like color with a small white head. Easy drinking pale ale. Nice citrus flavor from the added dry hop.

John L - Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a light orange-yellow, with minimal head. Aroma of sweet tropical fruit. Flavor has some citrus and tropical fruit, and plenty of hop bite. Soft mouthfeel. Somewhat bitter finish. Wonderful stuff.
lots of aroma of citra. good orange flavour. a lighter mouthfeel.some lace. good approachable.
Can cheers to Rich; cloudy golden yellow pour with a thin white head, aroma has resinous pine and orange squash, fizzy pine, quite bitter, fresh orange, amazing powdery hop action.

Tasted from can. Ridiculous tropical fruit aroma. Huge pineapple, peach, mango. Moderate to heavily bitter. Flavors of tropical fruit, grapefruit, resin on the finish. Incredible IPA with an insane aroma. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle at the April Fools Day DC Ratebeer tasting. Poured a hazy yellow color with a small off-white head. Aroma was nice tropical citrus notes, floral hop character was nice. Flavor was nice, tropical fruits, floral character. Light pine. Juicy and tasty.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2017 From mobile phone [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Novato: pours pale golden haze, slightly cloudy with foamy white head. Aroma-flavour: intense hop profile with notes of tropical fruits, pine, some citruses, supported with crisp like malt backbone. Finish is dry, slightly bitter. Hop bitterness is moderate to medium, body is moderate, texture smooth, carbonation is moderate.

475ml can at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Hazy yellow orange color with white head. Hoppy and malty aroma, grass, citrus, grapefruit, light pine. Light sweet and heavy bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation. I think I have to find one more can of this in better condition.

Tallboy can via IP trade. Poured a chunky orange New England style. Aroma of mango, apricot, peach, grains. Flavor changes a lot throughout. Started off rather sweet like rotting fruit but then cracker and grains pick up before finishing with drier citrus rind. Medium to fuller body with fizzy strong carbonation and an average duration on the aftertaste.

Draft @ RateBeer Best 2017. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty peachy hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy tropical fruit hoppy finish.
[1/26/17] Draught at Beercraft in Rohnert Park. Murky yellow-golden. Nice aroma of fruity hops, tropical, citric, somewhat oniony. Dry flavor with bitter fruity and oniony hops. Medium-bodied.
murky yellow. smells like rotten tropical fruit with onion behind it gasoline and farts. taste ok. hints of mustard and ketchup. very smooth. very thin. hazy brah
Can from solidfunk. NE IPA style pour. Lovely nose of tropica fruit and yeast. Tastes of mango, pineapple, yeasty, scallion, grapefruit, white grape light malt backbone. Fruity chewy palate. Nice

Bottle... Hazy sparkling-yellow pour with a tiny, brief, white head. The aroma features lots of citrus and tropical fruits accompanied by a rumor of muskiness. Light-bodied with a mildly creamy mouthfeel and tickling carbonation. The flavor is bright, fruity and moderately bitter with a nice, lightly sweet, biscuity component. Finishes with modest level of lingering bitterness. Bottle courtesy of 50belair!

16oz can. Thick, juicy unfiltered orange body. Creamy, steady off-white head. Thick, yeasty, world-class IPA. Has some tropical edge, but more of a deep hop balance, lots of depth. The malt backdrop is pretty standard Trillium, wheat and two row...extra yeasty. Solid.

Tallboy can. Canned 12/13/16 Opaque hazy golden, frothy/creamy offwhite head. Pungent aromas of tropical hops, resin. Medium bodied, fizzy carbonation. Medium sweet, lightly bitter. Juicy tropical flavors into a controlled finish. Bright and fresh.

Can, 1 pint. A cloudy amber beer with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma is of tropical hops and some resin. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation and some astringency at the end. Fruity finish, mainly of pinapple and citrics.

Mango, green onions, papaya and pineapple. Hazy orange brown pour with decent head and lacing. Light bitter finish with a hint of what almost seems like mint. Tall can from brewery thanks to girlfriend.
Can @ Mikkeller bar, Aarhus. Hazy yellowish pour with a frothy head. Notes of oranges, stone fruit, light passionfruit with a subdued bitterness. Juicy goodness!
cloudy, dark orange, intense thick head, just sticks around. hop bomb. smells like a tropical smoothie. crisp, bright, juice, extra dry. grapefruit and kiwi. finishes clean. lovey.

Can.
Hazy golden colored with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, citrus and pine needles with notes of exotic fruits.
Fruity flavor of hops, pine needles and citrus.
Hoppy finish.

Canette de 16 oz partagée lors dune dégustation entre amis. Arôme: Légère odeur dananas et de mangue. Apparence: La couleur est orangée opaque avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dananas et de mangue avec une pointe dagrume. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement houblonné. (Rating #7174)

Can. About 7 weeks old. Pours hazy unclear orange with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, mellow citrus fruits, dank hops, stone fruits, bread and juicy hops. Taste of dank hops, mellow citrus fruits, orange, grapefruit and bread crust. This held up pretty good compared to its age.
Can shared by Rasmusott. Thanks! Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aromas of citrus, dank hops, pineapple, mango, herbs. Taste is bitter, herbal, peachy, mandarin, citrus, mango.

Can, by way of a trade. Murky gold. Scummy, foamy, off white head. Nose has huge, fresh, grimy, greasy hop. Wow. This is so pungent. Notes of ripe pineapple. On the turn mandarin. Pretty dank and sweaty. Loads of warm weather stone fruits. Just loads of hop. Taste is light, juicy bitter. Malt sweetness comes across tinned and fruity. Soft and creamy mouthfeel. Light and bright. Finish ends up with the juice giving way to a bit of a resiny vibe. Mouthwatering, the whole way through.

Poured from a 16 oz can dated 11/01/2016. 
Aroma is super hop forward with lots of pineapple, mango and citrus notes. Some green, dank resinous notes balance out the fruit. Light cracker malt and wheat notes. 
Pours a very hazy, dull orange straw color with a medium sized, moderately thick, white head that recedes fairly quickly to the edges where it lingers in clumps. Medium light lacing and faint legs. 
Flavor is slightly to moderately sweet with some light cracker and wheat notes. Medium to medium high bitterness. Nice hop notes with lots of mango, citrus, tropical fruit and pineapple. Moderate dank, resinous, grassy notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice hoppy pale ale. Some sweetness without malt flavors that overwhelm the hops. Could be a bit fruitier in the flavor for my tastes.

Thank you Mathieu87 + PriorL for the effort! Can sampled @ Samson en Geert Bierproef Avond. Fresh - few weeks old. Very hazy creamy citrus with little head. Nose is onion, massive marihuana, most marihuana hop smelling beer I have ever head, smells like certain places in Amsterdam, some diesel hops, explosive. Super dank taste, creamy milkshake IPA but not too thick luckily, thick onion, onion dominates the marihuana a bit in the taste but is still clearly there, stupidly marihuana like, finish is some white grape. Very creamy weed body, onion, diesel hops. Favourite of the 5 hoppy Trillium beers tasted that night. Very nice brew & I am not the biggest fan of Vermont style Milkshake IPAs. I know that the can says APA but you might just as well clasify this one as an IPA.

Draft at the brewery. Pours opaque gold with a bubbly white head. Tastes like hop resin, grapefruit, pine hops, and bready malt. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like grapefruit hops, resin, pine, and bready malt.
11/01/16 dated can. Cloudy pale yellow. Aroma is citrius juice and fresh hop resin. Taste is dank, pine, some sweetness, low bitterness.

Tap at brewery. Pours hazy yellow/gold. Aroma is floral, grassy, and citrus hops, pale and toasted malts, faint dank, and faint straw. Flavor is clean, dry, and hoppy with nice citrus and grassy flavors with and spicy and lightly toasted finish. Medium body.

Canette 473ml, gracieuseté de msjpearson, Thanks Mike! Couleur orange majestueux, mousse blanche. Arôme de houblon résineux, mangue, cannabis. Goût de houblon résineux, dank, agrumes, malt, pointe dalcool, amertume moyenne-élevée, zeste dorange. Carbonatation faible, corps moyen.

Aroma - pungency, resin, floral, and citrus hops. Grapefruit, lemon, and slight starfruit.
Appearance - the body is a clouded yellow sunglow, with an orange like sunglow in the center. The head is around 1/3" and white, the head fades into a thin layer of foam.
Taste - has a rich mix of resin, slight pungency, floral, and citrus hops. The citrus is mostly of a grapefruit nature, slight starfruit, and lemon.
Palate - medium body, texture has a velvety oily nature, the carbonation is average, the finish is slightly bitter and dry.

can recieved in a trade, poured a cloudy dark golden colour with a soft white head. big tropical fruit notes, mango, pineapple, light tart citrus fruits, grass notes. soft tropical sweet juice aftertaste, nice floral bitter aftertaste. delicious
Can thanks to Seth. Pours a cloudy yellow orange with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is melon, grass, herbal. Medium body, juicy hop, grass, melon, earth, light bitterness, very good.

Tap at Deciduous Anniversary Party
Ugly murky grapefruit juice looking beer. Big grapefruit and citrus on the nose with plenty of sweet bread to back it up. Smells and tastes miles better than it looks. Nice to try but it didnt move me.
Can - Tropical fruit and grassy dank notes. Murky yellow orange. Lots of tropical notes and dank. No bitterness and very juicy. Nice.

500mL can, sent from wilco (thanks so much, Mike!), pours a cloudy orangey yellow with a small white head. Aroma is super dank, with loads of tropical fruits and dank hops. Flavour is like tropical fruit juice, with lots of mango, pineapple, guava, etc. with lots of citric dank hops. Basically no bitterness on the finish, just lots of dankness and tropical fruitiness. Way too easy to drink. Delicious.

Very cloudy, very pale. Fruity, light orange, a bit yeasty, Sweet front, moderate bitterness, and then there is a deep grapefruit, orange character, maybe a touch of mango. Very nice, pretty refreshing.

Sampled at CBC Boston 2016 with Andrew and Brendan. One of the highlights of the weekend. Pours a hazy, murky golden body with huge white head. Nose is premium dank character with funky citrus and soft minerality. Mouthfeel strikes a great balance between funky citrus and juicability; overall a nice dank hop profile with notes of fresh citrus, tropical fruits, mineral water, fresh pine, melon and mango.

Hazy golden orange with a fingers worth of head. Aroma of oranges, pine, citrus fruit, pineapple. Taste is herbaceous, huge citrus fruit, stone fruit, fresh fruits, bready malt. Medium body, medium bitterness. One of my favorite Trillium offerings!
thanks to Lukasmh. pour cloudy pale with a fine white head. aromas of pine, lemon, and skunk, taste light to medium bitter. full bodied hop juice with a heavy hoppy finish.

Can thanks to Lukas. Aroma of so fresh hops! Like a pure hops from the bag. Amazing pine, grass and citrus. Hazy yellow and lasting white head. Taste is light+ bitter and light sweet. Medium body, oily feel and bitter fresh hop finish.

Hazy golden yellow in color... Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits, mango... Flavor is juicy tropical fruits, citrus, fairly dry citrus hops on finish... Amazing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 oz can to pint (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a cloudy pineapplish banana with fizzy eggshell head that slowly but steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells of juicy and piney hops with a moderately bittersweet backbone. A nice presence of mango and pineapple. Tastes like it smells with a juicy medium-bodied mouthfeel. Tasty.
Can 1 pint. Opaque golden with a small, white head. Dankisk cat piss aroma. Medium body, a very dry fruitiness. Very intense tropical bitterness. Late, lingering hop bite. 280916
On tap at CBC. Poured a cloudy golden color with a smaller sized head. Pine, resin, citrus, and some tropical / pineapple.

Th S breakfast beer exploded with a fruity pineapple tropical citrus aroma and flavor with all the flavor but less bitterness than the best IPAs. Tops Zombie Dust and Psuedo Sue as my favorite pale ale to date. Just superb.

Tap at Copenhagen Beer Festival in Boston (9-24-2016) showing cloudy neon yellow with a finger of clean white foam.

The nose shows strong pine resin with good notes of pineapple and pine resin. 

The palate is light bodied and well carbonated. Flavors shows a near impossible high intensity of juicy pine resin. Theres so much pine resin flavor in this, the mouth seems to be permeated with a light minty mouthfeel. The finish shows a tea-like astringent bitterness with a return to more cannabis notes on the linger.
Pours a pale yellow with a white lacing. The aroma is citrus and mostly geapefruir and orange with some tropical notes. The flavor is bitter and the palate is dry.

Really hazy, milky looking peach color with off-white head. Aroma has apricot and mango juice with some grass on top. Tater starts really juicy with lots of tropical fruits. Finish has a quite light bitterness with dry aftertaste. Medium body with really smooth mouthfeel. Excellent beer, one of the best pale ales I ever had.

Can at home. Aroma of mango, sweet orange, pineapple, papaya, herbs. 
Pours like straight yellow pineapple juice with a pillowy white head. 
Taste is loads of mango and pineapple followed by a slightly herbaceous note. So soft and smooth yet very flavorful. 
Medium light body, soft carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, a bit pithy and juicy finish. 
This is a fantastic pale ale.
16 ounce can. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, and pine. Taste is pineapple, grapefruit, lemon, mango, and pine. Delicious.

Can from bytemesis. Thanks again Mike! It pours a very cloudy pale orange color with a small white head. The aroma has bright grapefruit, some grape and pineapple. The flavor is creamy with more grapefruit, spice with a little astringency and low bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel. Lots of green hop resin. This is one where the cloudiness seems a bit astringent on the palate. Great hop character though.
16oz CaN .. 8 days old so its already awful.. Orange juice pour .. Great foam .. East coast mouth .. Rich resin, citrus, the dreams of a 14 year old .. Nice beer .. . . I eat nail clippings

Mukry gold pour with a larger head. Aroma is ripe tropical fruit, mango, guava, slightly dank as well. Floral and fruity, tropical fruit, specifically Mango, dank, grassy. Medium body. Id be happy crawling into the can and living out my days there.

My Bottom Line:
This very aromatic IPA bursts with zesty citrus fruit juices over dank grassiness, an intense profile which manages to remain very drinkable.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam covers the murky yellow.
-Bitterness is kept in check, which increases drinkability.
-Tropical fruitiness spans from passionfruit to lemons, guava, mangos, etc.
-Carbonation is relatively low.

Can.
16oz can. Pours a milky yellow/orange haze. Nice subtle carbonation. Aroma of lemon, mango, passion fruit. Light tasting, and incredible to drink.

Fort point double dry hopped pale ale 6.6% can. 

An incredibly milky looking pale gold with a very juicy aroma of fruits. Light bodied, very dry and gassy. Delicious pine cones and juicy fruits flavor but that carbonation is not working for me.

Lets start with the aroma bomb,generous resinous potent 
From a can, so the appearance of the can is well an illustration of a lamppost.
The mouthfeel is to the point, straight no chaser dry hopped pine sawdust/chalk/resin.
Pretty much the perfect APA. If you can call it that. Pours like a grapefruit spremuta and just pillows in the glass. Wow.

Poured from bomber. Big, big, thanks to DSandanato for this one! Pours cloudy golden with a white head, almost looks like orange juice. Aroma is big fresh citrus, pineapple, grass, and dank pine resin. Flavor is big explosion of citrus , mango, pineapple, and grapefruit. Finish is citrus zest and dank pine resin. I have been fortunate enough to try a few different Trillium beers and they have lived up to the hype.

[ bottle ][ 1.5oz ][ @Tasting ][ $? ][ mini snifter ][ 05.01.16 ] 
same glowing straw body, thin oily white cap. Brighter nose, more grapefruit amidst the dough balance, grassy and light despite intensity. Front palate is sticky, resinous grapefruit and pine, softly doughy mid palate as it grows dryer, clinging to mouth in the sticky, dusty, lightly metallic end. The intense hop-forward experience that most IPA look for with the balance none imagine.

750 ml bottle from the South Boston brewery. Pours a deep cloudy yellow with a finger head, medium lacing. Heavy pinecone and botanical with a slight citrus aroma. Some fruit notes, orange rind, but more so on the herbal side. Full bodied with a long floral finish. Another home run from these guys.

Bottle share. Pours a murky yellow/orange with a foamy white head. Aromas of tropical and citrus fruits, herbal, dank, some onion. Flavor was pineapple, mango, orange, dank, herbal tea, and hints of the onion. Medium to full body, sticky texture, soft carbonation, and a bitter hop bite finish.

750ml bottle pours a muddy gold with some sudsy, white head. Nose is so clear, grassy, tropical fruit, light candy, tangerine, grapefruit soda. Flavor has light grist, lemon, guava, straw, honey. Finishes dry. Very very well done.

750 ml bottle I brought to the DC RateBeer Tasting. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, citrus, floral notes. Tastes of tropical fruit, citrus, floral notes, pine. Medium body with a dry finish.
Hazy gold orange pour. Surprising. Soap sud head. No lacing. Big hop aroma. Not much in the taste though. More bitter than the reg.
From a bottle at the DC gathering May 1, 2016. Pours a murky pale gold with an off white head. Aroma of citrus. Flavors of pineapple and grapefruit. Bitter finish.

75cl bottle. Large off-white head atop murky apple cider body. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some spicy, grapefruit rind, light grape. Taste is moderately sweet, grape, grapefruit, light spicy. Light-medium body, some effervescence.
Bottle. Cloudy pale yellow color, white head. Nice aroma of meadow, fresh fruit. Taste is fruity, floral dry finish.

April 9, 2016. On tap at Omnipollos Hatt. 
Cloudy orange with a large creamy head. Aroma is dank and fruity with mango, peach, pineapple, grapefruit, orange, some herbal notes and cereal. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium soft bitterness. Finish is sweet fruity and some toasted malt, mango, peach, bitter notes of grass, orange zest and slightly herbal notes. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Great!

Bottle. Pours really cloudy Arnold Palmer, medium creamy off white head, dissipates fairly quickly, nice lacing. Aroma is really juicy, tropical fruit, dank and potty, mango. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, juicy and dank, no hint of harshness. Medium body, soft mouthfeel. I love this series.

Bottle courtesy of Cory. Cheers, my friend. Pours a murky yellow with a white head. Nose is grass, lemongrass, lemon, citrus, peel, and malt. Flavor is similar with lemon, citrus, peel, and lemongrass with malt. Medium to full in body with lingering bitterness.

Tasted on 4/13/16 from a capped 750mL bottle, big thanks to Alex for sharing. Pours like pulpy orange juice with an average white head that leaves average, spotty lace. The nose is a really cool combination of earthy, piney, and tropical hops, showing really nice pineapple and orange peel. The flavor is even more tropical fruit and citrus peel with the earth and pine taking a back seat, with just a bit of nice grapefruit peel bitterness and bread. The body is medium with average carbonation, very textural, and a long nicely bitter tropical fruit and grapefruit peel finish.
Tap at Omnipollos Hatt. Cloudy golden with white head. Very fruity aroma and taste with grapefruit, peach, citrus, bubblegum and some floral tones to it. Slightly dry lime zest finish.

On tap at Hatten. 

Hazy golden/yellow with a white head. Fresh and nicely hoppy with citrus, apricot, pineapple and light hay. Medium body and with a bitter finish. A nicely drinkable one.

Draught at Hatten.
Cloudy yellow, thick off white head.
Fresh hops and citrus aroma with mango. Pretty similar to the Mosaic version but this one is more aromatic snd has more citrus zing.
Taste is refreshing citrus with some mango and extra twist of zesty hops. High bitterness. Juicy.
Medium bodied, soft carb, fluffy texture.
More ipa beer than the mosaic pale ale. More to my liking.

Pours cloudy mango with a medium foamy white head. Aromas of intense mango with apricot and peach as well. Taste is ridiculously fruity with quite substantial hope bitterness. Mouthfeel is juicy and creamy with medium carbonation
@ Hatten 16-4-9: riktig lätt och trevlig med fin humlebalans och tydlig fruktig ton. Rätt ok.
Bottle thanks to Frank - Pours yellow gold white head - nose/taste of tropical fruit, juicy pineapple, mango, grassy citrus peel and toasted malt - medium body

Bottle shared with friends, first time trying the double dry hopped version. Pours an ultra yeasty and murky golden orange. Looks like some Tired Hands ipas. Nose and flavor were mixed citrus mostly lemon and grapefruit with some light galaxy cheese, grass, and a touch of mango. Medium to fuller bodied.
Vibrant hazy gold pour with white tones and a nice white head. Aroma of orange, apricot, honeysuckle, melon. Flavor of orange, grapefruit, apricot, peach. Delicious. Great creamy mouthfeel. Amazing.

Very fresh bottle from Congress St. Pours a super hazy bright orange yellow, huge fluffy white head. Aroma is big grapefruit, mandarin orange, pine, dank citra resin. Flavor is gooey orange juice, mango, apricot, straw, pine. Body on the light side of medium - dank gooey crushable juice. Awesome.
yea great stuff. Tons of hop aroma and flavor, with a light wheat malt flavor, light bitterness, no alcohol present. Trillium at its finest.
Cloudy golden peach color. Aroma is mango, pineapple, grassy, dank, doighy. Taste is mild sweet and tons of green hoppyness.

Aroma: Dank, Dry Citrus Rind...
Appearance: Hazy Orangish/Brown Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing...
Taste: Dank, Resin, Grainy...
Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Drying, Mildly Bitter

Bottle I took to Campground Brewdown 2015. Pours a hazed gold with a medium sized white head. Big dank citrus on the nose, musk. Medium-bodied, soft musk, gentle sweetness. Slow musky citrus into a lingering melon finish.
This poured a nice hazy peach color with a white head. Aroma was big tropical hops, light dank quality too. Flavor similar, pops in the face, remains juicy all the way through. Awesome IPA.
22oz bottle thanks to rich. Pours out a hazy straw topped with a white head. nose is a nice hop mix plenty of melon sweetness. Taste is more of the nice melon hops and great sweetness.

Bottle (750 ml). Thanks to Brian and JulienHuxley for this one! Split 2-ways with Minderbinder. Hazy golden-orange with a medium white head, moderate retention, leaving some lacing. Aroma is herbal with citrusy hops, pine, tropical fruits, grass and cereals. Taste is grassy and herbal forward with a good malt backbone than isnt taking too much place but is definitely more noticeable and in the other and more juicy versions of Fort Point. Bitterness level is moderate. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Rather dry finish. Its a good Pale Ale no doubt about that but it lacks the punch and juicy / danky compononents that theres in all other Fort Point variations I have tried so far and in so many Trillium hoppy beers. Easy drinking.

Multiple bottles, from notes. My first taste of Trillium and it doesnt disappoint. Hop flavor and aroma is through the roof, with huge amounts of citrus, grapefruit, and dankness that keep coming in waves after waves. Little to no perceptible bitterness. Pretty hazy from the level of dry hopping. Overall, this is one of the best beers Ive ever had.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy blond with high white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of citrus, tropical fruits, pine, flowers. Taste is of citrus, tropical fruits, bitterness. Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Very nice. Juicy, fruity.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2017 Bottle shared by Dan. Nose is lightly peppery, a touch of fruitiness. Taste is initially very bitter for a pale ale. Hop flavor is awkward, more pepper flavor than expected, not very fruity. Hmm. Not a huge fan. 3.0 original rate

Rerate 6/19/17
Super juicy hop nose. Hop amazing juicy. Much better than before 3.6

Bottle shared. Glowing hazy orange gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is dank really leafy, piney, light tropical notes. Taste is really peppery, woody, bitter, light dank hop. Palate is med bodied, creamy. Good stuff, but I miss the really nice dank onion/garlic and/or tropical fruit explosion of a lot of the other Trilliums I tried.

Aroma of grapefruit, passionfruit, guava, melon, a bit of grass, straight up hoppy. Taste is incredibly hoppy, and doesnt leave the aroma behind in any sense, a bit herb like with big floral apricot reminiscent notes, best Pale Ale, surely.
Bottle. Pours orange with a white head. Aroma of tangerine, fresh hops, light peppery citrus, light skunk, fruity. Taste heavy is hops, citrus, orange, fresh hops.

From bottle. Pours murky golden with a white head. Aroma of tangerine, citrus, light floral, oranges. Taste is tangerine, crisp as fuck, citrus, light bubblegum, light dry finish. Holy f*cking f*ck, this is great!
Bottle @ Rekvium, Orla and Dolles dødsyge søndagssmagning, 2015. Pours hazy golden with a creamy white head. Skunky, piney, grapefruit. Extremely hoppy and fruity. Hop burpy!
Pours a cloudy pale orangey yellow with a white head. Aromas of mango, peach, lemon, tangerine. Light grain. Taste is light sweetness up front with a dryish bitter finish. Soft pillowy body.
Bottle shared thanks to Art. Poured very cloudy orange yellow with white head. Aroma of musky citrus sweet. Light carb med bod. Taste light bitter astringent pine.

8/X/15 - 1Pt. 9Fl. Oz. bottle from a trade @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: VIII/1/15 (2015-1459) Thanks to Chris for the trade and Thomas for muling!
Cloudy yellow beer, creamy irregular white head, little stable, very adhesive. Aroma: lots of pineapple, sourish, passion fruits, sweet peaches, fruity overall. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of pineapple, some grapefruit, citrus, grassy, resinous touch. Aftertaste: very nice bitterness, grapefruit, pineapple, very fruity, bit of honey, resinous.
Bottle purchased day of release at brewery: Bountiful hops with all the flavor and aroma of hops but with mild bitterness. Absolutely spectacular.

[7523-20150815] Bottle. Woody citrus aroma. Hazy, pale yellow orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head and some seriously sludgy bits. Orange wood syrup flavour has a bitter hoppy juice. Medium body. Good. (8/3/8/3/15) 3.7
(@ Campground Brewdown 2015, Millmont, PA)
Bottle at tderoecks place, thanks for sharing! Pineapple juice, with a nice subtle bitterness. This is lovely, like always!

750 mL bottle poured into a wine glass. Very hazy and murky bright orange. Small white head. Tropical aroma. Bright citrus and some garlicky hops. Taste has a wonderful tropical hop flavor. Juicy and orangey. Light pine in the back end with some faint bitterness. Some light pale malt. Medium body with soft carbonation. Absolutely delicious.
Bottle - pours very cloudy yellow. Nose is lemons, oranges, tangerines, grapefruits. Taste is bitter, grapefruit, lemons.

22oz bomber via trade, thanks to BDuke! It pours a hazy as hell pale yellow color with translucent green shades and late frothy white head. Aroma is astonishing fresh danky hops, grapefruit, mango, freshly cut grass, lemon zest, pine cones and weed. Taste is lightly bitter lightly tangy and crispy, with more bold fresh grassy weedy danky notes, white melon, mango and grapefruit. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, outstanding.

2015-08-15. Hazy orange body with a foamy white head. 3+ Big aroma of citrusy orange. Flavour is similar, big orange citrus character, lightly astringent, citrus oil. Mild resin and green hops. Average plus bodied palate, soft carbonation. Bottle at Campground Brewdown.

Bottle - Hazy golden amber pour with a filmy white head. Nose is dank and oniony with mellow booze and a sweet light bread malt base. Taste is the same, with a nice dry malt base, onion hops, and a bit of pine hops. Fluffy, soft body with ample carbonation.

Growler straight from HQ. Cloudy apricot pour with a white head. Citrus hop aromas. The taste follows suit with just a hint of resin and herbal hop notes. Faint orange zest backbeats. Really good body and mouthfeel. Not sure if the bottles can be this good. A stunner and damn fine APA.
750 poured into HF stemmed glass. Dank and citrusy. Pours a very cloudy orange. Incredible

The Double Dry Hopped beers are bottled too young, reviewing this at 4 days old. the aroma jumps out of the bottle before its even poured, but a muddy, turbid brownish orange appearance goes well beyond the "hazy dry hopped" look that weve become accustomed to with New England IPAs.
Taste is great, juicy citrus, dank herbal quality and finishing a bit less juicy and a bit more abrasive than the base, I think this has to do with the feel on the palate as hop particles and yeast proteins are still in suspension.
still great, but even better with a few more days on it.

I personally wish theyd let it condition a bit longer before releasing, but there are others who demand these before they are even finished.

Pours a hazy pale-yellow color with a froth, big head.

Offers a fantastic nose of fresh cut grass, water melon and ripe orange. The hops create an intense aroma, gently balanced by bready malts. Creates a ridiculous juiciness, reminding me of fruit juice with lemon zest blending into luscious, sun bathed oranges. 

Has a medium carbonation, with a supersoft, slightly mineralic mouthfeel. This showcases the hops in the best way possible, as there are no distractions whatsoever, very refreshing on the palate.

Tastes of aqueous minerals, setting the bar for the beers incredibly soft, almost silk mouthfeel. Hops do hover above this foundation on from the very beginning, while turning a lot grassier, as the carbonation rushes through, also revealing a profound dankness with crisp lemon zest on top. The hops turn even more complex by revealing hints of ripe orange, prickly kiwi and water melon which perfectly add to the beers dankness. Finishes with a leaf inspired dryness, among which rock sugar sparkled malts turn visible for a short glance, which then get wrapped up by sour, slightly slick lemon and juicy orange.

The nose on this blows me away, revealing an amazing, crisp diversity, which is nothing but perfect. It showcases a wider variety of aromas, which all come together perfectly, leaving no desire unfullfilled. Aromas get beautifully converted into the taste, providing a fantastic mouthfeel with lemon and oranges, with an enjoyable intensity, while remaining refreshing and easy drinkable.

Bottle shared thanks to JBPortland ! Pours a clumpy lumpy hazy gravy of hop sauce.. hop residue on cap hahaha finger of gaseous foam. Nose is punchy tropical hops, guava, pineapple, pine, citrus, soft grain, toasted malt. Palate follows with a juicy hop presence, nice bitterness cleans up the finish. Need to brush the hops leaf out of my teeth and Im curious if this is going to turn my piss green as well.

750ml bottle pors cloudy opaque pale yellow straw with medium head. Nose is full of tropical fruit, grassy pineapple, citrus, melon and a hint of soft grain. Taste is soft on the mouthfeel, light subtle dry malt holds up tons of juicy troical citrus, lemon, melon, kumquat, and orange. Finishes super dry, some grainy doughy yeast is present in the finish along with medium bitterness and more of the tropical grassy hop explosion. This beer is pretty ugly but thats neither here nor there in the end. Really good.

Bottle @ 5 Kay, 7.5 Kay, 10 Kay Tasting. Cheers, Leighton! Slightly hazy gold pour with a large white head. Hugely aromatic. Some jasmine tea and lemon sugar cookie. Fragrant mountain meadow. Orange peel and grass. Taste is quite similar. Soft and a touch chalky. Modest malt base that lets the hops shine. Grassy meadow, some more tea and herb. Bright, very delicate on the palate. Not particularly bitter. Great stuff.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is unbelievable, great pine and tropical fruit, sweet hops. Appearance its hazy, golden/amber, white head. Taste is boring, a little too balanced, astringent, tart, piny, yet bitter with no fruit aspect. Mouthfeel is a lot less carbonated than desired, thick in a weird way. Overall...extremely disappointing for what it is.

750 mL bottle shared with ebone1988. I got this from RuckIt on BA. The pour is a golden hay color, with no opacity. Almost like lemon juice mixed with beer. There is a bright white head that falls to a ring with some great lacing. The aroma is gorgeous. There is a beautiful hoppiness with a great citrus aspect and a lovely fruitiness on the back end. The flavor is mega disappointing. There is a start of citrus beauty and then it just gets dank and finishes like wet hops. It's almost like there is orange juice mixed into the beer. The mouth feel is good, well carbonated but the aftertaste is a bit astringent and carries wet hops through the end. I'd hoped for so much better

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at the pre-Zebra breakfast beer NS tasting. Pours murky yellow brown with a white head. Aroma of massive mango, tropical fruits, citrus and peach. Flavour is light sweet and over moderate bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Super hazy straw-orange body, medium to large white head, soapy lacing. Lots of grapefruit rind, pine needles, resin, mango, lemon zest, and light cracker. There is a vegetal quality to this that comes and goes with the sips lacking the vegetal character being more enjoyable. Medium bodied with soft carbonation, assertive bitterness that is a tad astringent. A bit over-hopped. Prefer the base Fort Point more so.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2017 32oz growler filled 5/15/15 and drunk 5/17/15Hazy, soft sunset orange hues with a white head that is well-retained atop.Fruity aromatics, much like the Pier I just drank from them. Citrus (lemon rind, red grapefruit) as well as very light watermelon and light pine. All enjoyable, yet there is a persistent doughiness/blandness here that seems much stronger in this sample than in any Ive had from them recently. Malts are well-attenuated and provide light honey in the nose, as well, there is no alcohol noted. Sniffable, for days, like most Trillium pale ales, but I just cant get past the extreme haziness of alot of their beers.Again, enjoyable hoppiness to begin the beer, with a medium body overall and tight carbonation producing a creamy texture. Watermelon, grapefruit, papaya, oranges and limes are all the things you want in an APA. But as the beer progressed, doughy-like flavors built up, with some degree of astringency, severely dampening the flavor and overall experience.  As well, I found it to be too sweet, with more warming, and a bit underfermented.It sucks that the great IPA producers cant really seem to avoid this (this happens at Night Shift, Hill Farmstead, Jacks Abby, Alchemist, to name a few right off the top of my head). I know the hop particulate dosent drop out the way most yeast will. Ive stuck bottles of Jacks Abby and Trillium in the fridge for weeks without effect. Still, I think some of these beers get rushed out a bit too fast with the assumption that the cloudiness is all from the hops and not the yeast, when in fact, the beer still needs a little more time.I will admit that a little bit of haziness is rarely going to have much of an effect, and I usually look past that, but this thing was just too much. Will get a bottle and let it sit in the fridge for a while and see if that produces a better result.Need to update this one.  While I dont think it has quite the intense flavor and aroma of DDH Congress Street, its still a delicious beer and has been pretty consistent since the first and only subpar experience I had.  Very spicy, dank, dry and green with less rich, sweet juice than the Street series.  Score is based on my overall impression amongst many batches, draught, bottle and can.

Bottle shared at the 5K/7.5K/10K tasting - who has a 7.5K tasting? big thanks to Leighton for more Trillium goodness, 30/12/14. 
Hazed orange amber with a big old eggshell white head that retains well - picture postcard beer!
Nose is big juicy citrics, pine needles, juicy hop wash, spruce, mandarin, tangerine, fresh citricana drive by.
Taste comprises light mineral notes, straw, mandarin, tangerine, light apricot, melon.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with grassy hop bitterness and a light pine needleage.
Super solid IPA - Trillium showing the others the way!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 32oz growler in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma strong of citrusy and floral and fruity hops, some light malts, light dough, and hints of wheat/grains. Flavor the same with a great blend of the hops and other ingredients. Average texture. A really good beer.

30th December 20145 Kay, 7.5 Kay, 10 Kay Tasting. Big thanks to Leighton for more Trillium hoppy happiness! Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Big nose of tropical fruits. Palate is smooth and light and semi dry. Good fine carbonation. Light pale malts, mild malt cream. Hops start with a good dose of skunk then there is strong pithy grapefruit and lighter orange marmalade. Bitter pine and hop spice. Trace of tropical fruits and more bitterness before a light airy finish. Strong bitter linger. Lovely!

Bottle, courtesy of a kind soul... shared in a location remote of my dining room.
Pours a pale yellow with a nice head and some nice lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is very hop forward, fruity & dank with a great apricot, orange, and melon thing happening. 

The flavor is modestly bitter with plenty of bright fruity hop flavor. Its clean and fairly dry. Hop forward in all manner of speaking without being unpleasant in any way whatsoever. 
Chill palate, just xochtl. 

Hell of a damn deal.

Hazy golden, decent ringed white head. Rich grapefruit, dusty hop citrus and gummy lime. Crisp stumbled citrus on the initial taste, minty lime and middling is burgeoning passion fruit. Decent cooling carbonation and a decent fuzzy mouthfeel. Finishes more gummy citrus, firm bitter linger. Fresh, 11/22/14. Bottle, Poncey Southerner Tasting, Cheers Leighton
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy yellow, nose is resinous, citra, taste is dry, bitter, citrus, juicy.
Bottle. Golden with white head. Aroma is resinous, pine, grapefruit. Taste is resinous, mango, pine, some grapefruit. Quite bitter

bottle at home ... hazy amber ... small white head ... soft sherbert ... soft fruit ..oily juicy lemon fruit grapefruit nose ... dry zezty lime fruit ... oily zezty fruits ... soft floral fruit ... light dry fruit ... lime .. pine .. ligth toffee .. oily fruits ..
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy gold with a thick white head. Aromas of citrus, resin. Taste is oily, bitter. Sweet finish. Nice.

Bottle, big thanks to Leighton. It pours hazy pale orange with a thick white head. The nose is sweet, juicy, tangerine, dried mango, passion fruit, straw, grass and light spice. The taste is bitter-sweet, juicy, passion fruit, mango, straw, pepper, earth, toasty grass, spice, light alcohol and soap with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Hop juice. Very nice.

Bottle shared in London - picked up at the brewery last week. Pours hazy gold with a large, frothy white head. Big dank hop nose with ample pine, grapefruit, piss. Light to medium sweet flavor with understated pale malts, lots and lots of fresh, vibrant and juicy hops, pithy grapefruit, mandarin orange. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Lightly resinous on the finish with soft grassy bitterness, more joyful citrusy hops, grapefruit, lemon rind, pine needles. Outstanding.

750 ml bottle thanks going to Willrunforbeer on this gem. Mostly hazy gold with massive head retention that coated the glass. Fantastic aroma! Citrus upfront, scallions, grassy with good yeast. The dry hopping is crazy good.
The flavor is just as nice. Very citrus forward with the grassy/ floral notes hitting in the backend. The bitterness is moderate and again grass and scallion nots. Body is on the medium light side but very palatable. The drinkability is wonderful, so much hop flavor. Thanks for this Brian !
750mL bottle. Pours yellow orange gold with a big white head. Aroma is strong citrus, grapefruit and lemon. Flavor is dank, grapefruit, grapefruit peel bitterness in the finish. Really nice.
750ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with a lot of head. Citrus hoppiness, particularly lemon. Great hop balance and yeast to add some extra complexity.

bunch of bootles and groolers. big juicy tropical fruits. tangerines. oranges. clementines. pineapple. bit of grapefruit and resin xhinin in the cut. perhaps a touch too bitter. but citrusy hop character is fun. thanks gazza!

Pours hazy gold into a tulip. Bright white head with medium retention recedes leaving spider lacing to coat surface. Tropical fruit, farmhouse and resin aromas. Soft with grass, caramel and toffee upfront turning to passionfruit and mango before the lasting citrus pith finish. Drier than other versions with a lasting parching tongue lashing finish...
